publisher: Ajax, Electra, Oedipus Tyrannus, Loeb Classical Library (Harvard University Press
title: Jean Bollack, L’Oedipe roi de Sophocle: Le texte et ses interpretations (Presses Universitaires de Lille
Sophoclis Fabulae
Greek Poets
Linear B and Related Scripts
The story of the discovery and decipherment of Mycenaean writing
The Great Sophists in Periclean Athens
A balanced assessment of the role of the sophists in Athenian culture
The Aegean Bronze Age to Iron Age
A survey of what is now known about the material conditions of Greece in the Dark Age
The Coming of the Greeks: Indo-European Conquests in the Aegean and the Near East
Analysis of the evidence for the date of the arrival of Greek-speaking Indo-Europeans in Greece. . The End of the Bronze Age

An examination of explanations for the destruction of the Mycenaean palaces. After criticizing other views, the author defends the theory that changes in military technology and tactics made chariots obsolete and left palaces and cities at the mercy of piratical raiders
Ancient Greece from Prehistoric to Hellenistic Times
A brief, accessible survey of Greek history

container-title: Osborne, Robin. Greece in the Making 1200–479 B.C
title: Early Greece
A detailed history of Archaic Greece from the end of the Dark Age to the Persian War

A history of Greece from the Mycenaean Age to the end of the Archaic Period. Distinguished by careful attention to the nature of the sources of our information and the way in which their statements about the past reflected their own circumstances and conflicts
Ancient Greece: A Political, Social, and Cultural History
A history of Greece from Mycenae to the Hellenistic Age. Emphasis on social and cultural conditions as well as political and military ones
Greece in the Bronze Age
The classic introduction to life in Mycenaean Greece
A defense of the surprising thesis that Oedipus was not the son of Laius and Jocasta and did not kill the former
Oedipus Tyrannus”: A New Translation, Passages from Ancient Authors, Religion and Psychology: Some Studies, Criticism. A Norton Critical Edition
A prose translation and a selection of critical essays and other sources, including Thucydides’ account of the plague in Athens

note: Reprinted frequently (e.g., in Berkowitz and Brunner and in O’Brien).
title: On Misunderstanding the Oedipus Rex
A highly regarded essay arguing that Oedipus does not have a tragic flaw and that he is not the victim of fate. He is a hero who faces the fact that all human happiness is an illusion

note: Argues that Apollo brought about Oedipus’ fall to punish him for his hubris.
title: The Theatre of Apollo: Divine Justice and Sophocles’ Oedipus the King

note: An anthology of influential writings on the play.
title: Oedipus at Thebes
The classic presentation of the case that Oedipus may be understood as a symbol of Periclean Athens
Twentieth-Century Interpretations of Oedipus Rex
Oedipus Tyrannus: Tragic Heroism and the Limits of Knowledge. Twayne Masterworks Series
Comprehensive background information and running commentary on the play for Greekless readers
The Guilt of Oedipus
Defense of the interpretation that Oedipus knew that Laius and Jocasta were probably his real parents
A Companion to Greek Tragedy
A collection of essays by leading scholars treating a wide range of topics related to Greek tragedy
Greek Tragic Theatre
An engaging introduction, with attention to archaeological as well as literary evidence and interesting speculation about stage effects
A Guide to Ancient Greek Drama: Blackwell Guides to Classical Literature
A good general introduction to Greek drama and some current scholarly debates. The Delphic Oracle Bowden, Hugh. Classical Athens and the Delphic Oracle: Divination and Democracy
The influence of the Oracle of Delphi in Athens. A less skeptical consideration than Fontenrose’s
The Delphic Oracle: Its Responses and Operations with a Catalogue of Responses
A work debunking romantic conceptions of the oracle. Genuine oracles are said to have given straightforward approval of laws and religious decrees
The Lives of the Greek Poets
A deconstruction of
The Poetics of Aristotle: Translation and Commentary
A translation of and commentary on Aristotle’s Poetics containing a balanced, up-to-date discussion of the hamartia controversy and other issues raised by Aristotle’s essay
